item.title: Report E-2025030139
item.description:
Report E-2025030139

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-07
  • City: LAKELAND
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES L
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 7, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon jerrican of UN3098 was crushed and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized hand tools, absorbents, and neutralizing agents to remove the spilled product. The damaged jerrican and all cleanup debris were containerized in one (1)55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report I-2025030006
item.description:
Report I-2025030006

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-29
  • City: Miami
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LAPARKAN TRADING
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Loader loaded the hazardous Drum into a container and tried to load a plastic barrel next to the hazardous drum while trying to place the plastic barrel next to the hazardous drum the forklift blade inadvertently punctured the hazardous steel drum. Warehouse manager and Operations manager was called to the scene immediately, the operations manager reached out to the company's hazardous specialist who provided the instructions to be in compliance, we quickly got our protective gears on and diked the drains, we then started to pour absorbent on the spill and covered all area where the spill reached, after the absorbent absorbed all the spill we placed the waste in a 1H2 Barrel and sealed them for disposal.
